greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f.: Product_{n>=1} (1 - x^(2*n-1))^(-1/(2*n-1)).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..448
formula: a(n)/n! is the Euler transform of [1, 0, 1/3, 0, 1/5, 0, 1/7, 0, ...].
E.g.f.: A(x) = B(x) / sqrt(B(x^2)), where B(x) = e.g.f. of A028342.
E.g.f. A(x) satisfies: Product_{n>=0} A(x^(2^n))^(1/2^n) = e.g.f. of A028342.
E.g.f.: exp(Sum_{k>=1} (d(2*k) - d(k))*x^k/k), where d(k) = number of divisors of k (A000005). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 17 2018
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[If[OddQ[d], 1, 0], {d, Divisors[j]}]* b[n - j], {j, 1, n}]/n];
Table[a[n], {n, 0, 25}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 10 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 06 2012
